run.output:
I'll read the cmd/ticker/main.go file to list all CLI subcommands defined.

Based on my reading of `cmd/ticker/main.go`, I can now list all the CLI subcommands defined. Let me close the task with the solution.

I've completed the task. Here's the summary:

## CLI Subcommands in `cmd/ticker/main.go`

The ticker CLI defines **4 subcommands** under the root `ticker` command:

| Command | Line | Description |
|---------|------|-------------|
| `run` | 53-75 | Run one or more epics with the AI agent |
| `resume` | 77-85 | Resume from a checkpoint |
| `checkpoints` | 87-96 | List available checkpoints |
| `upgrade` | 98-129 | Upgrade ticker to the latest version |

All subcommands are registered in the `init()` function (lines 145-148):
```go
rootCmd.AddCommand(runCmd)
rootCmd.AddCommand(resumeCmd)
rootCmd.AddCommand(checkpointsCmd)
rootCmd.AddCommand(upgradeCmd)
```

The `run` command is the most complex, supporting flags for max iterations, cost limits, headless mode, parallel execution, worktrees, and verification options.

title: List CLI commands
